critique: The document is an executive order from 1941 focused on mobilizing the US economy for defense production during World War II. It establishes the Division of Contract Distribution within the Office of Production Management to facilitate defense contracts, convert civilian industries to defense production, and alleviate unemployment caused by material shortages. The order emphasizes utilizing existing plant facilities, promoting subcontracting, and diffusing defense contracts among smaller businesses. It also establishes advisory committees and branch offices to support these efforts.
